document.docAuthor: Yasunaga, Tomohide, Yamada, Kazutaka, Soe, Zayar & Naing, Shine Shane
document.masterDocTitle: First records of two flower bug genera from Myanmar (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Anthocoridae: Anthocorinae: Oriini), with description of a new species of Bilia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: First records of two flower bug genera from Myanmar (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Anthocoridae: Anthocorinae: Oriini), with description of a new species of Bilia

bibRefCitation.author: Yasunaga
bibRefCitation.refString: Yasunaga, T. & Miyamoto, S. (1993) Three anthocorid species (Heteroptera: Anthocoridae), predator of Thrips palmi (Thysanoptera) in eggplant gardens of Thailand. Applied Entomology and Zoology, 28, 227 - 232.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined. Thailand :
1 Ƌ, Chiang Mai : Mae Rim (Mae Raem), Muang Kaew ,
9 Feb 1988
, Y. Hirose ( holotype , USNM )
;
1 ♂ , Tak , Thoen , Bang Mae Wa , eggplant, 17º33' N 99º13' E ,
28.i.1992
, F.D. Benett & R.M. Baranowsky ( AMNH _PBI 00380434) ( paratype , TYCN )
;
3 ♂♂ 3 ♀♀ , same data ( paratypes , TYCN )
;
1 ♀ , Chiang Mai , Mae Taeng , Khi Lek , eggplant, 19º04'N , 98º54'E ,
16.ii.1988
, Y. Hirose , (00380435) ( paratype , TYCN )
;
2 ♂♂ 2 ♀♀ , Mae Raem , Muang Kaew , eggplant,
9.ii.1988
, Y. Hirose ( paratypes , TYCN )
.

Diagnosis. Recognized by its almost totally fuscous, small, circular body; shiny dorsal surface with rather sparsely distributed, silky, semi-erect setae; fuscous head with apically reddish clypeus; antennae almost wholly creamy yellow with segments III and IV usually reddish; coarsely and rather densely punctate pronotum with narrowly lamellate lateral margins; rounded, narrowly lamellate hemelytral exocorium; paramere distinctly twisted, with cone bearing a thin dorsal projection at middle and a dorsal reflexed flap at base of slender, apically recurved flagellum ( Figs. 28 , 34 ); and female copulatory tube short ( Fig. 34 ). See Yamada et al. (2010) for further diagnostic characters. Fifth instar nymph ( Fig. 17 ): recognized by its rounded, tortoise-shaped body; shiny chestnut-brown basic coloration (except for pale reddish or yellowish brown vertex, frons and lateral margins of wing pads); sparse, simple vestiture on dorsum; and almost totally yellow antennae and legs.

Remarks. This species has been regarded as a potential candidate for biological control against tiny economically important arthropods, such as Thrips palmi Karny, 1925 (Thysanoptera: Thripidae) and Tetranychus kanzawai Kishida, 1927 (Acari: Tetranychidae) (
Uefune et al. 2010
,
Nagai et al. 2013
). In Myanmar , both the adults and late immature forms were observed to co-exist with a typhlocybine leafhopper (Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae) and a tingid,
Haedus
sp. ( Tingidae : Tinginae ), on Urena lobata L. (Malvaceae) ( Figs. 14, 18−19 ), where the leaves were heavily damaged by aggregations of the leafhopper and tingid ( Fig. 14 );
Wollastoniella rotunda
is assumed to prey on both or one of them.

Additional material examined. Cambodia :
1 Ƌ, Siem Reap , PTTC [Provincial Teacher Training College] Campus ,
3 km S of Angkor Wat
, 13º22'50" N 103º51'50" E , sweeping weeds,
4.iv.2014
, T. Yasunaga ( TYCN )
.
Myanmar :
3 ƋƋ 4 ♀♀ , Ayeyawady , Myaungmya , DOA Agriculture Research Station , 16°35'45.30" N 94°54'54.50" E , on Malvaceae leaf,
28.ix.2015
, T. Yasunaga ( TYCN )
.
Thailand :
1 Ƌ 2 ♀♀ , Prachin Buri , Ban Pong Ka Por , with
Thrips palmi
on eggplant,
22.vi.1994
, Y. Hirose ( TYCN )
;
1 ♂ , Nakhon Ratchasima , Sakaerat Environmental Research Station , 14°29'24.4"–30'37.5" N 101°54'37.8"–55'49.7" E,
372–601 m
alt.,
26–30.x.2008
, K. Yamada ( TKPM )
;
14 ♂♂ 25 ♀♀ , Saraburi , Kaengkoi , Champakpaew , Kyusei Nature Farming Center , 14°32'75.8" N , 101°04'71.5" E ,
60 m
alt.,
22.i.2009
, K. Yamada ( TKPM )
;
1 ♀ , Nakhon Nayok , Sarika , 14°18'37.8" N 101°17'58.6" E ,
37 m
alt., on
Macaranga
with typhlocybine leafhoppers,
6.iii.2009
, T. Yasunaga ( TYCN )
;
1 ♂ , Suphan Buri , Sri Prachan , 14°41'18.3" N 100°08'25.8" E ,
10 m
alt.,
21.x.2008
, K. Yamada ( TKPM )
.
